member.summary: Unknown phone number type.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLog
member.summary: Provides access to the Call Log on the device which records incoming and outgoing calls made.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLog.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of .

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLog.GetEntry
member.summary: Retrieves the current from the call log.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLog.Seek(OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLogSeek,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initiates a search that ends at a given entry in a call log.
member.param: Location within the call log where the search will begin.
The zero-based index value of an entry in the call log, starting at the beginning of the log if seek is CallLogSeek.Beginning and at the end if seek = CallLogSeek.End.
member.returns: zero-based index value from the beginning of the seek pointer after the search is completed.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLog.Close
member.summary: Closes the Call Log

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLog.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the at the specified zero-based index

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLogEntry
member.summary: Contains details of a specific call log entry.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLogEntry.StartTime
member.summary: The start time of the logged call.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLogEntry.EndTime
member.summary: The end time of the logged call.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLogEntry.CallType
member.summary: Indicates whether the call was missed (incoming), answered (incoming), or outgoing.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLogEntry.Outgoing
member.summary: Indicates the direction of the call (missed calls are incoming).

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLogEntry.Connected
member.summary: Indicates whether the call connected (as opposed to a busy signal or no answer).

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLogEntry.Ended
member.summary: Indicates whether the call ended (as opposed to being dropped).

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLogEntry.Roaming
member.summary: Indicates whether the call was made while roaming (as opposed to a call made within the home service area).

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLogEntry.CallerIDType
member.summary: The caller ID type.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLogEntry.Number
member.summary: The telephone number of the call.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLogEntry.Name
member.summary: The name associated with the call.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLogEntry.NameType
member.summary: The name type associated with the call. For example, "w" would correspond with the work telephone number, "h" would correspond with the home telephone number, and so on.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.CallLogEntry.Note
member.summary: File name of the Notes file associated with the call (if a Notes file exists).

member.summary: The type of call represented in the .

member.summary: An answered incoming call.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Phone.Phone
member.summary: Creates new voice calls on the Pocket PC Phone Edition or Smartphone device.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Phone.Phone.MakeCall(System.String)
member.summary: Make a voice call to the specified number.
member.param: A valid phone number to be dialled.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Phone.Phone.MakeCall(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Make a voice call to the specified number optionally prompting the user before dialling.
member.param: A valid phone number to be dialled.
If True user will be prompted before call is made, else call will be made without user intervention.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Phone.Phone.MakeCall(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Make a voice call to the specified number optionally prompting the user before dialling.
member.param: A valid phone number to be dialled.
If True user will be prompted before call is made, else call will be made without user intervention.
A display name for the party being called.

member.summary: Retrieves the status of a given SMS message.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.Sms.GetStatus(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the status of a given SMS message, waiting within a specified timeout.
member.param: The message id, retrieved from the SendMessage method.
Timeout in milliseconds to wait for a response.
member.returns: An SmsMessageStatus structure containing status information, or null (Nothing in VB) if unavailable.

member.param: SmsAddress data in a Byte array.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsAddress.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new instance of SmsAddress with a specified address.

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsAddress.#ctor(System.String,OpenNETCF.Phone.AddressType)
member.summary: Create a new instance of SmsAddress with a specified address and type.
member.param: A member of the SmsAddressType Enumeration

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsAddress.ToByteArray
member.summary: Returns a flat Byte Array of the Sms Address data

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsAddress.op_Implicit(OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsAddress)~System.Byte[]
member.summary: Cast SmsAddress object to a byte array

member.name: M:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsAddress.op_Implicit(System.Byte[])~OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsAddress
member.summary: Cast byte array to SmsAddress object.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsAddress.Type
member.summary: The address type.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsAddress.Address
member.summary: The address in string format. For example, "127.0.0.1" or "+1.800.123.4567".

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.DataEncoding
member.summary: The data encoding that is primarily used for outgoing text message types.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.DataEncoding.Optimal
member.summary: Chooses the data encoding that fully represents all of the characters in the least amount of space.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.DataEncoding.Gsm
member.summary: Use the default GSM 7-bit encoding specified in GSM specification 03.38 "Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+); Alphabets and language-specific information." Characters that cannot be represented by this encoding will not be transmitted correctly.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.DataEncoding.Ucs2
member.summary: Use the Unicode UCS2 encoding.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsMode
member.summary: Specifies mode of the SMS object.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsMode.Receive
member.summary: Sms is opened for receiving incoming messages.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsMode.Send
member.summary: Sms is opened for sending outgoing messages.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.DeliveryOptions
member.summary: Specifies options for delivery of an SMS Message.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.DeliveryOptions.None
member.summary: No special options

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.DeliveryOptions.NoRetry
member.summary: Unless this option is specified, the router will retry sending the SMS message according to a pre-defined short-term retry schedule. If this option is specified, no retries will be attempted.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.MessageStatus
member.summary: Specifies the state of an SMS Message.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.BroadcastLanguage
member.summary: Indicates the languages that the mobile device provides.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.MessageClass
member.summary: Determines the class of the SMS Message.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.MessageClass.Class0
member.summary: The message should be displayed immediately but not stored.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.MessageClass.Class1
member.summary: The message should be stored and an acknowledgement should be sent to the Service Center when it is stored.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.MessageClass.Class2
member.summary: The message should be transferred to the SMS data field in the subscriber identity module (SIM) before an acknowledgement is sent to the Service Center. If the message cannot be stored in the SIM and there is other short message storage available, an unspecified protocol error message is returned to the Service Center. See GSM specification 04.11 "Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+); Point-to-Point (PP) Short Message Service (SMS) support on mobile radio interface" for more detail. If all the short message storage is already in use, a memory error message is returned to the Service Center.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.MessageClass.ClassUnspecified
member.summary: When the message has successfully reached the destination and can be stored, an acknowledgement is sent to the Service Center. See GSM specification 07.05 "Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+); Use of Data Terminal Equipment - Data Circuit terminating; Equipment (DTE - DCE) interface for Short Message Service (SMS) and Cell Broadcast Service (CBS)" for more detail.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.MessageOptions.None
member.summary: No options are specified.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.MessageOptions.StatusReport
member.summary: Requests a delivery status report.

member.name: F:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.MessageOptions.Discard
member.summary: Sets the Discard bit for the message.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsMessage
member.summary: Represents an individual SMS message.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.MessageProtocol
member.summary: SMS Protocol Identifier (PID) constants.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsMessageStatus
member.summary: Describes the status of an SMS message.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsMessageStatus.MessageID
member.summary: A message identifier returned when calling SmsSendMessage.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsMessageStatus.Status
member.summary: The status of the message.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsMessageStatus.RecipientAddress
member.summary: The destination address of the message.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsMessageStatus.ServiceCenterTimeStamp
member.summary: The time when the service center received the sent message.
member.remarks: For a status information response resulting from a multipart message, this field contains the most recent timestamp of all the multipart messages.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.SmsMessageStatus.DischargeTime
member.summary: The time pertaining to the particular outcome defined in MessageStatus.
member.remarks: For a status information response resulting from a multipart message, this field contains the most recent discharge timestamp of all the multipart messages.

member.name: T:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.TextProviderSpecificData
member.summary: Summary description for TextProviderSpecificData.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.TextProviderSpecificData.MessageClass
member.summary: Sets the message class.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.TextProviderSpecificData.ReplaceOption
member.summary: Text SMS messages with the appropriate flag can replace previously received notifications with a similar flag and originating address.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.TextProviderSpecificData.HeaderData
member.summary: The information contained in the header. For multi-part messages, only the header from the first segment is returned.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.TextProviderSpecificData.ContainsEMSHeaders
member.summary: Flag that indicates that at least one segment of this message contains EMS headers. Only set this flag if the EMS handler installed.

member.name: P:OpenNETCF.Phone.Sms.TextProviderSpecificData.ProtocolID
member.summary: The Protocol Identifier (PID) of an invoming message, or the desired PID of an outgoing message. This applies to GSM only.
